description: Indeps have no duties beyond those of communication, few Indeps ever noticed the thinning they choose . To impose responsibilities on Free League of their ranks . members would be hypocritical, and the far-flung, infor- In recent memory, several leaders have appeared among mal nature of the group would make any sort of unified the group, specifically a skilled bard, Bria Tomay, and a decision or requirement meaningless . Despite having no pair of twin wemics, Lethea and Lesander . Noticing the official requirements, Indeps help fellow members when- disappearance of their friends from the streets and alleys ever possible as a matter of honor and kinship . Members of the Great Bazaar, the focal point of the faction’s influ- provide what aid they can, which might range from helping ence in Sigil, these charismatic leaders set to organizing at another member’s shop to fighting by her side against secret meetings among their fellows with the hopes of enemies, depending on the Indep’s capabilities . discovering the reason . Bria and the wemics never found their answer, though . The free league in the World Each of the trio was banished to an inescapable extradi- “Think for yourself! Don’t listen to me!” mensional maze by the Lady of Pain in the first days of —Valek Xander, Indep wanderer the chaotic Faction War, when all factions were ultimately exiled from Sigil . By the war’s culmination, the Free Members of the Free League might appear anywhere . League’s leaders were lost and its members banished Since the group has no rigid organization or responsi- from the City of Doors . This situation meant little to the bilities, any individual could be a member . Whether in Indeps, though . Their ideology blended well with the the outspoken philosophizing of a planar traveler or the purely natural plane of the Outlands, and cast-off members quiet determination of a local baker, the vibrant spirit found a new home there, while countless others relocated of freedom and independence flourishes in brutally to other planes and Material worlds, ultimately spreading oppressed communities and in unlikely souls . Even their group’s dogma . Though they removed their badges, or scrawled on an alley wall serves as a sign of hope and they did not change their ways . Even now, after all the aid to the free-willed . It was recently has no formal opinions and performs no official acts, banished, however, along with all the other factions, and no one can really approve or disapprove of its doings . now many Indeps make their home in the gatetown of Thus, people’s opinions of the organization stem from Tradegate on the Outlands . their experiences with specific Indeps they’ve known or DC 30: Characters who achieve this level of success heard about . Setting up a meeting with an Indep is often as easy as While these are the opinions of commoners, some in coming across one on the road or entering one’s shop . In positions of power see the Free League as a significant areas where personal freedoms are oppressed and mem- threat . name: Information

description: Above all other duties, members of the Blind Tower are expected to be discreet . No matter how potentially lucrative the revelation might be, they must keep the secrets of their employers, of discoveries made on missions, and of the Tower itself . Those who breach this barrier of professional secrecy might become the targets of their peers’ next assignments . The blind Tower in the World “We didn’t see anything we weren’t paid to.” —Mister Tower, after successfully testing and overcoming the defenses of the royal vault The Blind Tower is a two-faced organization . It hires out talent to those who lawfully seek the abilities of skilled detectives and daredevils, but it also provides cunning bounty hunters, thieves, and brigands to anyone with enough coin to pay . Thus the Blind Tower’s services fall within a moral and legal gray area, and might aid the truly desperate as often as the truly criminal . Members and those who employ the organization alike face the quandary of being involved with the best in the business, despite the The Blind Tower moral questions raised by the group’s mercenary nature .
name: Responsibilities
